name: FedRAMP Moderate
description: Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program — Moderate baseline. Based on NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5, FedRAMP provides a standardized approach to security assessment, authorization, and continuous monitoring for cloud products and services used by U.S. federal agencies.

domains.name: Access Control
domains.description: Policies and procedures for managing access to information systems and data

controls.title: Access Control Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate access control policy and procedures.

controls.title: Account Management
controls.description: Manage information system accounts including establishing, activating, modifying, reviewing, disabling, and removing accounts.

controls.title: Account Management — Automated System Account Management
controls.description: Employ automated mechanisms to support management of information system accounts.

controls.title: Account Management — Automated Temporary and Emergency Account Removal
controls.description: Automatically remove or disable temporary and emergency accounts after a defined time period.

controls.title: Account Management — Disable Accounts
controls.description: Disable accounts when no longer required within defined timeframe.

controls.title: Account Management — Automated Audit Actions
controls.description: Automatically audit account creation, modification, enabling, disabling, and removal actions.

controls.title: Account Management — Inactivity Logout
controls.description: Log out users after a defined period of inactivity.

controls.title: Account Management — Disable Accounts for High-Risk Individuals
controls.description: Disable accounts of users posing significant risk.

controls.title: Access Enforcement
controls.description: Enforce approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources.

controls.title: Information Flow Enforcement
controls.description: Enforce approved authorizations for controlling the flow of information within the system and between interconnected systems.

controls.title: Separation of Duties
controls.description: Separate duties of individuals to prevent malicious activity without collusion.

controls.title: Least Privilege
controls.description: Employ the principle of least privilege, allowing only authorized accesses for users necessary to accomplish assigned tasks.

controls.title: Least Privilege — Authorize Access to Security Functions
controls.description: Authorize access to security functions and security-relevant information explicitly.

controls.title: Least Privilege — Non-Privileged Access for Nonsecurity Functions
controls.description: Require that users of system accounts use non-privileged accounts when accessing nonsecurity functions.

controls.title: Least Privilege — Privileged Accounts
controls.description: Restrict privileged accounts to specific personnel or roles.

controls.title: Least Privilege — Log Use of Privileged Functions
controls.description: Log the execution of privileged functions.

controls.title: Least Privilege — Prohibit Non-Privileged Users from Executing Privileged Functions
controls.description: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

controls.title: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts
controls.description: Enforce a limit of consecutive invalid logon attempts by a user and automatically lock the account.

controls.title: System Use Notification
controls.description: Display approved system use notification message or banner before granting access.

controls.title: Concurrent Session Control
controls.description: Limit the number of concurrent sessions for each account.

controls.title: Device Lock
controls.description: Prevent further access to the system by initiating a device lock after a defined period of inactivity.

controls.title: Device Lock — Pattern-Hiding Displays
controls.description: Conceal information previously visible on display with a publicly viewable image.

controls.title: Session Termination
controls.description: Automatically terminate a user session after conditions are met or defined time period.

controls.title: Permitted Actions Without Identification or Authentication
controls.description: Identify and document specific user actions permitted without identification or authentication.

controls.title: Remote Access
controls.description: Establish and document usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and implementation guidance for remote access.

controls.title: Remote Access — Monitoring and Control
controls.description: Employ automated mechanisms to monitor and control remote access methods.

controls.title: Remote Access — Protection of Confidentiality and Integrity Using Encryption
controls.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality and integrity of remote access sessions.

controls.title: Remote Access — Managed Access Control Points
controls.description: Route remote accesses through authorized and managed network access control points.

controls.title: Remote Access — Privileged Commands and Access
controls.description: Authorize and document all privileged commands and access to security-relevant information via remote access.

controls.title: Wireless Access
controls.description: Establish usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and authorization for wireless access.

controls.title: Wireless Access — Authentication and Encryption
controls.description: Protect wireless access to the system using authentication and encryption.

controls.title: Access Control for Mobile Devices
controls.description: Establish usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and connection requirements for organization-controlled mobile devices.

controls.title: Access Control for Mobile Devices — Full Device or Container-Based Encryption
controls.description: Employ full-device or container-based encryption to protect confidentiality and integrity of information on mobile devices.

controls.title: Use of External Systems
controls.description: Establish terms and conditions for authorized individuals to access the system from external systems.

controls.title: Use of External Systems — Limits on Authorized Use
controls.description: Permit authorized individuals to use an external system to access the system only after verification of controls on the external system.

controls.title: Use of External Systems — Portable Storage Devices — Restricted Use
controls.description: Restrict the use of organization-controlled portable storage devices on external systems.

controls.title: Publicly Accessible Content
controls.description: Designate individuals authorized to post information on publicly accessible systems, review content before posting, and ensure nonpublic information is not posted.

domains.name: Awareness and Training
domains.description: Security awareness and training for organizational personnel

controls.title: Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate awareness and training policy and procedures.

controls.title: Literacy Training and Awareness
controls.description: Provide security and privacy literacy training to system users.

controls.title: Literacy Training — Insider Threat
controls.description: Provide literacy training on recognizing and reporting potential indicators of insider threat.

controls.title: Role-Based Training
controls.description: Provide role-based security and privacy training to personnel with assigned security roles.

controls.title: Training Records
controls.description: Document and monitor security and privacy training activities.

domains.name: Audit and Accountability
domains.description: Audit logging, analysis, reporting, and retention for information system events

controls.title: Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate audit and accountability policy.

controls.title: Event Logging
controls.description: Identify the types of events that the system is capable of logging and define auditable events.

controls.title: Content of Audit Records
controls.description: Ensure audit records contain sufficient information to establish what events occurred, when, where, source, outcome, and identity.

controls.title: Content of Audit Records — Additional Audit Information
controls.description: Generate audit records containing additional detailed information.

controls.title: Audit Log Storage Capacity
controls.description: Allocate audit log storage capacity and configure auditing to reduce the likelihood of capacity exceeded.

controls.title: Response to Audit Logging Process Failures
controls.description: Alert designated personnel in the event of an audit logging process failure and take defined additional actions.

controls.title: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting
controls.description: Review and analyze system audit records for indications of inappropriate or unusual activity.

controls.title: Audit Record Review — Automated Process Integration
controls.description: Integrate audit review, analysis, and reporting processes using automated mechanisms.

controls.title: Audit Record Review — Correlate Audit Record Repositories
controls.description: Analyze and correlate audit records across different repositories.

controls.title: Audit Record Reduction and Report Generation
controls.description: Provide and implement an audit record reduction and report generation capability.

controls.title: Audit Record Reduction — Automatic Processing
controls.description: Provide and implement the capability to process, sort, and search audit records for events of interest.

controls.title: Time Stamps
controls.description: Use internal system clocks to generate time stamps for audit records.

controls.title: Protection of Audit Information
controls.description: Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.

controls.title: Protection of Audit Information — Access by Subset of Privileged Users
controls.description: Authorize access to management of audit logging functionality to only a subset of privileged users.

controls.title: Audit Record Retention
controls.description: Retain audit records for a defined time period to provide support for after-the-fact investigations and regulatory requirements.

controls.title: Audit Record Generation
controls.description: Provide audit record generation capability for the events defined and allow designated personnel to select auditable events.

controls.title: Audit Record Generation — System-Wide and Time-Correlated Audit Trail
controls.description: Compile audit records from all components into a system-wide time-correlated audit trail.

controls.title: Audit Record Generation — Changes by Authorized Individuals
controls.description: Provide and implement the capability for authorized individuals to change the auditing to be performed based on operational requirements.

domains.name: Assessment, Authorization and Monitoring
domains.description: Security assessment, authorization, and continuous monitoring of information systems

controls.title: Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate assessment, authorization, and monitoring policy.

controls.title: Control Assessments
controls.description: Develop a control assessment plan, assess controls, produce assessment report, and provide results to designated personnel.

controls.title: Control Assessments — Independent Assessors
controls.description: Employ independent assessors or assessment teams to conduct control assessments.

controls.title: Information Exchange
controls.description: Approve and manage the exchange of information between the system and other systems using interconnection security agreements.

controls.title: Plan of Action and Milestones
controls.description: Develop and update POA&M for the system documenting planned remediation actions.

controls.title: Authorization
controls.description: Assign authorizing official, obtain authorization before operations, and update authorization as needed.

controls.title: Continuous Monitoring
controls.description: Develop a continuous monitoring strategy and implement a continuous monitoring program.

controls.title: Continuous Monitoring — Independent Assessment
controls.description: Employ independent assessors or assessment teams to monitor the controls on an ongoing basis.

controls.title: Continuous Monitoring — Risk Monitoring
controls.description: Ensure risk monitoring is an integral part of the continuous monitoring strategy.

controls.title: Penetration Testing
controls.description: Conduct penetration testing at a defined frequency on defined systems.

controls.title: Internal System Connections
controls.description: Authorize internal connections of system components and document for each connection the interface characteristics, security requirements, and information communicated.

domains.name: Configuration Management
domains.description: Configuration management, change control, and baseline configuration of information systems

controls.title: Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate configuration management policy.

controls.title: Baseline Configuration
controls.description: Develop, document, and maintain a current baseline configuration of the system.

controls.title: Baseline Configuration — Automation Support for Accuracy and Currency
controls.description: Employ automated mechanisms to maintain an up-to-date, complete, accurate, and readily available baseline configuration.

controls.title: Baseline Configuration — Retention of Previous Configurations
controls.description: Retain previous versions of baseline configurations to support rollback.

controls.title: Baseline Configuration — Configure Systems and Components for High-Risk Areas
controls.description: Issue systems with defined configurations to individuals traveling to high-risk locations.

controls.title: Configuration Change Control
controls.description: Determine and document types of changes under configuration control, review proposed changes, approve/disapprove changes, document change decisions.

controls.title: Configuration Change Control — Testing, Validation, and Documentation of Changes
controls.description: Test, validate, and document changes to the system before finalizing the implementation.

controls.title: Impact Analyses
controls.description: Analyze changes to the system to determine potential security and privacy impacts prior to change implementation.

controls.title: Access Restrictions for Change
controls.description: Define, document, approve, and enforce physical and logical access restrictions associated with changes.

controls.title: Configuration Settings
controls.description: Establish and document configuration settings for components that reflect the most restrictive mode.

controls.title: Configuration Settings — Automated Management, Application, and Verification
controls.description: Employ automated mechanisms to manage, apply, and verify configuration settings.

controls.title: Least Functionality
controls.description: Configure the system to provide only mission-essential capabilities and prohibit or restrict use of non-essential functions, ports, protocols, and services.

controls.title: Least Functionality — Periodic Review
controls.description: Review the system at a defined frequency to identify and disable unnecessary functions, ports, protocols, and services.

controls.title: Least Functionality — Prevent Program Execution
controls.description: Prevent program execution in accordance with defined policies.

controls.title: System Component Inventory
controls.description: Develop and document an inventory of system components that accurately reflects the system.

controls.title: System Component Inventory — Updates During Installation and Removal
controls.description: Update the inventory whenever components are installed or removed.

controls.title: System Component Inventory — Automated Unauthorized Component Detection
controls.description: Employ automated mechanisms to detect the presence of unauthorized components and take defined actions.

controls.title: Software Usage Restrictions
controls.description: Use software and associated documentation in accordance with contract agreements and copyright laws.

controls.title: User-Installed Software
controls.description: Establish and enforce policies governing the installation of software by users.

domains.name: Contingency Planning
domains.description: Contingency planning, business continuity, and disaster recovery

controls.title: Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate contingency planning policy.

controls.title: Contingency Plan
controls.description: Develop a contingency plan that identifies essential mission and business functions, provides recovery objectives, restoration priorities, and roles and responsibilities.

controls.title: Contingency Plan — Coordinate with Related Plans
controls.description: Coordinate contingency plan development with other plans (COOP, DR, IR, etc.).

controls.title: Contingency Plan — Resume Mission Functions
controls.description: Plan for the resumption of mission-essential functions within a defined time period.

controls.title: Contingency Plan — Identify Critical Assets
controls.description: Identify critical system assets supporting mission-essential functions.

controls.title: Contingency Training
controls.description: Provide contingency training to system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities.

controls.title: Contingency Plan Testing
controls.description: Test the contingency plan at a defined frequency using defined tests to determine plan effectiveness.

controls.title: Contingency Plan Testing — Coordinate with Related Plans
controls.description: Coordinate contingency plan testing with organizational elements responsible for related plans.

controls.title: Alternate Storage Site
controls.description: Establish an alternate storage site including necessary agreements to permit the storage and retrieval of backup information.

controls.title: Alternate Storage Site — Separation from Primary Site
controls.description: Identify an alternate storage site that is geographically separated from the primary site.

controls.title: Alternate Processing Site
controls.description: Establish an alternate processing site and initiate necessary agreements to permit transfer and resumption of operations.

controls.title: Alternate Processing Site — Separation from Primary Site
controls.description: Identify an alternate processing site geographically separated from the primary processing site.

controls.title: Telecommunications Services
controls.description: Establish alternate telecommunications services including necessary agreements.

controls.title: System Backup
controls.description: Conduct backups of user-level, system-level, and security-related documentation at a defined frequency.

controls.title: System Backup — Testing for Reliability and Integrity
controls.description: Test backup information at a defined frequency to verify media reliability and information integrity.

controls.title: System Recovery and Reconstitution
controls.description: Provide for the recovery and reconstitution of the system to a known state within defined time period after a disruption.

domains.name: Identification and Authentication
domains.description: Identification and authentication of users, devices, and services

controls.title: Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate identification and authentication policy.

controls.title: Identification and Authentication (Organizational Users)
controls.description: Uniquely identify and authenticate organizational users.

controls.title: Multi-Factor Authentication to Privileged Accounts
controls.description: Implement multi-factor authentication for access to privileged accounts.

controls.title: Multi-Factor Authentication to Non-Privileged Accounts
controls.description: Implement multi-factor authentication for access to non-privileged accounts.

controls.title: Access to Accounts — Replay Resistant
controls.description: Implement replay-resistant authentication mechanisms for access.

controls.title: Acceptance of PIV Credentials
controls.description: Accept and electronically verify Personal Identity Verification credentials from other federal agencies.

controls.title: Device Identification and Authentication
controls.description: Uniquely identify and authenticate devices before establishing a connection.

controls.title: Identifier Management
controls.description: Manage information system identifiers by receiving authorization, assigning identifiers, preventing reuse, and disabling after inactivity.

controls.title: Identifier Management — Identify User Status
controls.description: Manage individual identifiers by uniquely identifying each individual as a contractor, government, or other defined category.

controls.title: Authenticator Management
controls.description: Manage system authenticators by verifying identity, establishing initial authenticator content, protecting authenticators, and changing/refreshing authenticators.

controls.title: Authenticator Management — Password-Based Authentication
controls.description: For password-based authentication: enforce minimum complexity, number of changed characters, store and transmit cryptographically protected passwords.

controls.title: Authenticator Management — Public Key-Based Authentication
controls.description: For PKI-based authentication: validate certifications by constructing a certification path and verifying against an accepted trust anchor.

controls.title: Authenticator Management — Protection of Authenticators
controls.description: Protect authenticators commensurate with the security category of the information.

controls.title: Authentication Feedback
controls.description: Obscure feedback of authentication information during the authentication process.

controls.title: Identification and Authentication (Non-Organizational Users)
controls.description: Uniquely identify and authenticate non-organizational users.

controls.title: Acceptance of PIV Credentials from Other Agencies
controls.description: Accept and electronically verify PIV credentials from other agencies.

controls.title: Acceptance of External Authenticators
controls.description: Accept only FICAM-approved external authenticators.

controls.title: Use of Defined Profiles
controls.description: Conform to defined profiles for identity management.

domains.name: Incident Response
domains.description: Incident response planning, handling, monitoring, and reporting

controls.title: Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate incident response policy.

controls.title: Incident Response Training
controls.description: Provide incident response training to system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities.

controls.title: Incident Response Testing
controls.description: Test the incident response capability at a defined frequency using defined tests.

controls.title: Incident Response Testing — Coordination with Related Plans
controls.description: Coordinate incident response testing with organizational elements responsible for related plans.

controls.title: Incident Handling
controls.description: Implement an incident handling capability that includes preparation, detection and analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery.

controls.title: Incident Handling — Automated Incident Handling Processes
controls.description: Employ automated mechanisms to support the incident handling process.

controls.title: Incident Monitoring
controls.description: Track and document system security and privacy incidents.

controls.title: Incident Reporting
controls.description: Require personnel to report suspected incidents to the organizational incident response capability and report incidents to required authorities.

controls.title: Incident Reporting — Automated Reporting
controls.description: Employ automated mechanisms to assist in the reporting of incidents.

controls.title: Incident Response Assistance
controls.description: Provide an incident response support resource integral to the organizational incident response capability.

controls.title: Incident Response Assistance — Automation Support
controls.description: Increase the availability of incident response information and support using automated mechanisms.

controls.title: Incident Response Plan
controls.description: Develop an incident response plan that provides the organization with a roadmap for implementing its incident response capability.

domains.name: Maintenance
domains.description: System maintenance, tools, and remote maintenance

controls.title: Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate system maintenance policy.

controls.title: Controlled Maintenance
controls.description: Schedule, perform, document, and review records of system component maintenance.

controls.title: Maintenance Tools
controls.description: Approve, control, and monitor the use of system maintenance tools.

controls.title: Maintenance Tools — Inspect Tools
controls.description: Inspect maintenance tools carried into a facility for improper or unauthorized modifications.

controls.title: Maintenance Tools — Inspect Media
controls.description: Check media containing diagnostic and test programs for malicious code before use.

controls.title: Nonlocal Maintenance
controls.description: Approve and monitor nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities, allow use only as consistent with policy.

controls.title: Maintenance Personnel
controls.description: Establish a process for maintenance personnel authorization and maintain a list of authorized maintenance organizations or personnel.

domains.name: Media Protection
domains.description: Media protection, access, marking, storage, transport, sanitization, and use

controls.title: Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate media protection policy.

controls.title: Media Access
controls.description: Restrict access to digital and non-digital media to authorized individuals.

controls.title: Media Marking
controls.description: Mark system media indicating distribution limitations, handling caveats, and applicable security markings.

controls.title: Media Storage
controls.description: Physically control and securely store digital and non-digital media.

controls.title: Media Transport
controls.description: Protect and control digital and non-digital media during transport.

controls.title: Media Transport — Cryptographic Protection
controls.description: Employ cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality and integrity of information stored on media during transport.

controls.title: Media Sanitization
controls.description: Sanitize system media prior to disposal, release, or reuse using approved methods.

controls.title: Media Sanitization — Equipment Testing
controls.description: Test sanitization equipment and procedures at a defined frequency.

controls.title: Media Use
controls.description: Restrict the use of certain types of media on systems or system components.

domains.name: Physical and Environmental Protection
domains.description: Physical access controls, monitoring, and environmental protection for facilities and systems

controls.title: Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate physical and environmental protection policy.

controls.title: Physical Access Authorizations
controls.description: Develop, approve, and maintain a list of individuals with authorized access to the facility.

controls.title: Physical Access Control
controls.description: Enforce physical access authorizations at defined entry/exit points by verifying individual access authorizations and controlling ingress/egress.

controls.title: Access Control for Transmission
controls.description: Control physical access to system distribution and transmission lines within organizational facilities.

controls.title: Access Control for Output Devices
controls.description: Control physical access to output devices to prevent unauthorized individuals from obtaining information.

controls.title: Monitoring Physical Access
controls.description: Monitor physical access to the facility where the system resides to detect and respond to physical security incidents.

controls.title: Monitoring Physical Access — Intrusion Alarms and Surveillance Equipment
controls.description: Monitor physical access using intrusion alarms and surveillance equipment.

controls.title: Visitor Access Records
controls.description: Maintain visitor access records and review regularly.

controls.title: Power Equipment and Cabling
controls.description: Protect power equipment and cabling for the system from damage and destruction.

controls.title: Emergency Shutoff
controls.description: Provide the capability of shutting off power to the system in emergency situations.

controls.title: Emergency Power
controls.description: Provide an uninterruptible power supply to facilitate orderly shutdown or transition to long-term alternate power.

controls.title: Emergency Lighting
controls.description: Employ and maintain automatic emergency lighting that activates in the event of power outage.

controls.title: Fire Protection
controls.description: Employ and maintain fire detection and suppression systems.

controls.title: Fire Protection — Automatic Fire Suppression
controls.description: Employ automatic fire suppression capability when the facility is not staffed on a continuous basis.

controls.title: Environmental Controls
controls.description: Maintain temperature and humidity levels within the facility within acceptable levels and monitor at defined frequency.

controls.title: Environmental Controls — Monitoring with Alarms and Notifications
controls.description: Employ environmental monitoring that provides an alarm or notification to designated personnel for temperature or humidity changes potentially harmful to equipment.

controls.title: Water Damage Protection
controls.description: Protect the system from damage resulting from water leakage by providing master shutoff or isolation valves that are accessible, working properly, and known to key personnel.

controls.title: Delivery and Removal
controls.description: Authorize and control information system-related components entering and exiting the facility and maintain records of the items.

controls.title: Alternate Work Site
controls.description: Employ security controls at alternate work sites and assess the effectiveness of controls.

domains.name: Planning
domains.description: Security and privacy planning

controls.title: Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate planning policy and procedures.

controls.title: System Security and Privacy Plans
controls.description: Develop, review, update, and protect system security and privacy plans.

controls.title: System Security Plan — Plan and Coordinate with Other Organizational Entities
controls.description: Plan and coordinate security-related activities with other organizational entities.

controls.title: Rules of Behavior
controls.description: Establish and provide to individuals requiring access a set of rules that describe their responsibilities and expected behavior.

controls.title: Rules of Behavior — Social Media and External Site/Application Usage Restrictions
controls.description: Include restrictions on social media, personal email, and external site usage.

controls.title: Baseline Selection
controls.description: Select a control baseline for the system.

controls.title: Baseline Tailoring
controls.description: Tailor the selected control baseline by applying specified tailoring actions.

domains.name: Program Management
domains.description: Information security program management across the organization

controls.title: Information Security Program Plan
controls.description: Develop and disseminate an organization-wide information security program plan.

controls.title: Information Security Program Leadership Role
controls.description: Appoint a senior information security official with the mission and resources to coordinate, develop, implement, and maintain the program.

controls.title: Information Security and Privacy Resources
controls.description: Include the resources needed to implement the information security and privacy programs in capital planning and investment requests.

controls.title: Plan of Action and Milestones Process
controls.description: Implement a process to ensure that plans of action and milestones are developed and maintained.

controls.title: System Inventory
controls.description: Develop and maintain an inventory of organizational systems.

controls.title: Measures of Performance
controls.description: Develop, monitor, and report on the results of information security and privacy measures of performance.

controls.title: Enterprise Architecture
controls.description: Develop and maintain an enterprise architecture with consideration for information security and privacy.

controls.title: Risk Management Strategy
controls.description: Develop a comprehensive strategy to manage security and privacy risk to organizational operations and assets.

controls.title: Authorization Process
controls.description: Manage the security and privacy state of organizational systems through the authorization process.

controls.title: Mission and Business Process Definition
controls.description: Define organizational mission and business processes and determine the information protection needs.

controls.title: Testing, Training, and Monitoring
controls.description: Implement a process for ensuring that organizational plans for conducting security and privacy testing, training, and monitoring activities are developed and maintained.

controls.title: Security and Privacy Groups and Associations
controls.description: Establish and institutionalize contact with security and privacy groups and associations.

controls.title: Threat Awareness Program
controls.description: Implement a threat awareness program that includes a cross-organization information-sharing capability.

domains.name: Personnel Security
domains.description: Personnel security screening, termination, transfer, and access agreements

controls.title: Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate personnel security policy.

controls.title: Position Risk Designation
controls.description: Assign a risk designation to all organizational positions and establish screening criteria.

controls.title: Personnel Screening
controls.description: Screen individuals prior to authorizing access to the system.

controls.title: Personnel Termination
controls.description: Upon termination of individual employment: disable system access within defined timeframe, terminate/revoke authenticators, conduct exit interviews, retrieve all system-related property.

controls.title: Personnel Transfer
controls.description: Review and confirm ongoing operational need for current access authorizations when individuals are reassigned or transferred.

controls.title: Access Agreements
controls.description: Develop and document access agreements and ensure individuals acknowledge and sign before being granted access.

controls.title: External Personnel Security
controls.description: Establish personnel security requirements for external providers and monitor compliance.

controls.title: Personnel Sanctions
controls.description: Employ a formal sanctions process for individuals failing to comply with established policies and procedures.

controls.title: Position Descriptions
controls.description: Incorporate security and privacy role requirements in organizational position descriptions.

domains.name: PII Processing and Transparency
domains.description: Personally identifiable information processing, consent, and transparency

controls.title: Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate PII processing and transparency policy.

controls.title: Authority to Process PII
controls.description: Determine and document the legal authority that permits the processing of PII.

controls.title: PII Processing Purposes
controls.description: Identify and document the purposes for processing PII.

controls.title: Consent
controls.description: Implement tools or mechanisms for individuals to consent to the processing of their PII prior to its collection.

controls.title: Privacy Notice
controls.description: Provide effective notice to individuals regarding the processing of PII.

controls.title: System of Records Notice
controls.description: Publish system of records notices in the Federal Register for systems containing PII.

domains.name: Risk Assessment
domains.description: Risk assessment, vulnerability scanning, and risk monitoring

controls.title: Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate risk assessment policy.

controls.title: Security Categorization
controls.description: Categorize the system and the information it processes, stores, and transmits.

controls.title: Risk Assessment
controls.description: Conduct an assessment of risk including the likelihood and magnitude of harm from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, disruption, modification, or destruction.

controls.title: Risk Assessment — Supply Chain Risk Assessment
controls.description: Assess supply chain risks associated with systems, system components, and system services.

controls.title: Vulnerability Monitoring and Scanning
controls.description: Monitor and scan for vulnerabilities in the system and hosted applications at a defined frequency and when new vulnerabilities potentially affecting the system are identified.

controls.title: Vulnerability Scanning — Update Vulnerabilities to Be Scanned
controls.description: Update the system vulnerabilities to be scanned prior to each scan or when new vulnerabilities are identified.

controls.title: Vulnerability Scanning — Privileged Access
controls.description: Implement privileged access authorization to system components for selected vulnerability scanning activities.

controls.title: Vulnerability Scanning — Public Disclosure Program
controls.description: Establish a public reporting channel for receiving reports of vulnerabilities in organizational systems.

domains.name: System and Services Acquisition
domains.description: System development lifecycle, acquisition, testing, and supply chain protection

controls.title: Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate system and services acquisition policy.

controls.title: Allocation of Resources
controls.description: Determine, document, and allocate the resources required to protect the system as part of the capital planning process.

controls.title: System Development Life Cycle
controls.description: Manage the system using a system development life cycle that incorporates information security and privacy considerations.

controls.title: Acquisition Process
controls.description: Include security and privacy functional requirements, strength requirements, assurance requirements, and documentation requirements in the acquisition contract.

controls.title: Acquisition Process — Functional Properties of Controls
controls.description: Require the developer to provide a description of the functional properties of the controls employed.

controls.title: Acquisition Process — Design and Implementation Information
controls.description: Require the developer to provide design and implementation information for the security controls.

controls.title: Acquisition Process — Functions, Ports, Protocols, and Services in Use
controls.description: Require the developer to identify the functions, ports, protocols, and services intended for organizational use.

controls.title: System Documentation
controls.description: Obtain or develop administrator and user documentation for the system that describes secure configuration, installation, operation, and maintenance.

controls.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles
controls.description: Apply security and privacy engineering principles in the specification, design, development, implementation, and modification of the system.

controls.title: External System Services
controls.description: Require that providers of external system services comply with organizational security requirements.

controls.title: External System Services — Identification of Functions, Ports, Protocols, and Services
controls.description: Require providers to identify the functions, ports, protocols, and other services required for the use of such services.

controls.title: Developer Configuration Management
controls.description: Require the developer to perform configuration management during development, implementation, and operation.

controls.title: Developer Testing and Evaluation
controls.description: Require the developer to create a security assessment plan, implement the plan, and produce evidence of testing results.

controls.title: Development Process, Standards, and Tools
controls.description: Require the developer to follow a documented development process that explicitly addresses security requirements, use defined standards and tools, and document tool configurations.

controls.title: Unsupported System Components
controls.description: Replace system components when support for the components is no longer available from the developer, vendor, or manufacturer; or provide alternative sources for continued support.

domains.name: System and Communications Protection
domains.description: System and communications protection including boundary protection, cryptography, and denial of service protection

controls.title: Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate system and communications protection policy.

controls.title: Separation of System and User Functionality
controls.description: Separate user functionality from system management functionality.

controls.title: Information in Shared System Resources
controls.description: Prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources.

controls.title: Denial-of-Service Protection
controls.description: Protect against or limit the effects of denial-of-service attacks by employing defined controls.

controls.title: Boundary Protection
controls.description: Monitor and control communications at the external managed interfaces and at key internal boundaries.

controls.title: Boundary Protection — Access Points
controls.description: Limit the number of external network connections to the system.

controls.title: Boundary Protection — External Telecommunications Services
controls.description: Implement a managed interface for each external telecommunication service and establish a traffic flow policy.

controls.title: Boundary Protection — Deny by Default and Allow by Exception
controls.description: Deny network communications traffic by default and allow network communications traffic by exception.

controls.title: Boundary Protection — Split Tunneling for Remote Devices
controls.description: Prevent split tunneling for remote devices connecting to organizational systems unless explicitly approved.

controls.title: Boundary Protection — Route Traffic to Authenticated Proxy Servers
controls.description: Route internal communications traffic to external networks through authenticated proxy servers.

controls.title: Transmission Confidentiality and Integrity
controls.description: Protect the confidentiality and integrity of transmitted information.

controls.title: Transmission Confidentiality and Integrity — Cryptographic Protection
controls.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure and detect changes during transmission.

controls.title: Network Disconnect
controls.description: Terminate the network connection associated with a session at the end of the session or after a defined period of inactivity.

controls.title: Cryptographic Key Establishment and Management
controls.description: Establish and manage cryptographic keys using automated mechanisms with supporting procedures.

controls.title: Cryptographic Protection
controls.description: Determine the cryptographic uses and implement required cryptography for each use.

controls.title: Collaborative Computing Devices and Applications
controls.description: Prohibit remote activation of collaborative computing devices and applications and provide indication of use to users.

controls.title: Public Key Infrastructure Certificates
controls.description: Issue public key certificates under an appropriate certificate policy or obtain public key certificates from an approved service provider.

controls.title: Mobile Code
controls.description: Define acceptable and unacceptable mobile code and technologies, establish usage restrictions and implementation guidance.

controls.title: Secure Name/Address Resolution Service (Authoritative Source)
controls.description: Provide additional data origin authentication and integrity verification artifacts for authoritative name resolution data.

controls.title: Secure Name/Address Resolution Service (Recursive or Caching Resolver)
controls.description: Request and perform data origin authentication and data integrity verification on name/address resolution responses.

controls.title: Architecture and Provisioning for Name/Address Resolution Service
controls.description: Ensure the systems performing name/address resolution are fault-tolerant and implement internal/external role separation.

controls.title: Session Authenticity
controls.description: Protect the authenticity of communications sessions.

controls.title: Protection of Information at Rest
controls.description: Protect the confidentiality and integrity of information at rest.
typical_evidence: Key management for data at rest

controls.title: Protection of Information at Rest — Cryptographic Protection
controls.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure and modification of information at rest.

controls.title: Process Isolation
controls.description: Maintain a separate execution domain for each executing system process.

domains.name: System and Information Integrity
domains.description: System integrity, flaw remediation, malware protection, and monitoring

controls.title: Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate system and information integrity policy.

controls.title: Flaw Remediation
controls.description: Identify, report, and correct system flaws; test updates; install security-relevant patches within defined timeframe.

controls.title: Flaw Remediation — Automated Flaw Remediation Status
controls.description: Employ automated mechanisms to determine the state of system components with regard to flaw remediation.

controls.title: Malicious Code Protection
controls.description: Implement signature-based and non-signature-based malicious code protection at system entry and exit points and at workstations, servers, or mobile computing devices.

controls.title: Malicious Code Protection — Central Management
controls.description: Centrally manage malicious code protection mechanisms.

controls.title: Malicious Code Protection — Automatic Updates
controls.description: Automatically update malicious code protection mechanisms.

controls.title: System Monitoring
controls.description: Monitor the system to detect attacks, indicators of compromise, unauthorized local/network connections, and unauthorized use.

controls.title: System Monitoring — System-Wide Intrusion Detection System
controls.description: Connect and configure individual intrusion detection tools into a system-wide intrusion detection system.

controls.title: System Monitoring — Automated Tools and Mechanisms for Real-Time Analysis
controls.description: Employ automated tools and mechanisms to support near real-time analysis of events.

controls.title: System Monitoring — Inbound and Outbound Communications Traffic
controls.description: Monitor inbound and outbound communications traffic for unusual or unauthorized activities or conditions.

controls.title: System Monitoring — System-Generated Alerts
controls.description: Alert designated personnel when indications of compromise or potential compromise occur.

controls.title: Security Alerts, Advisories, and Directives
controls.description: Receive information system security alerts, advisories, and directives from designated external organizations on an ongoing basis.

controls.title: Security and Privacy Function Verification
controls.description: Verify the correct operation of security and privacy functions.

controls.title: Software, Firmware, and Information Integrity
controls.description: Employ integrity verification tools to detect unauthorized changes to software, firmware, and information.

controls.title: Software Integrity — Integrity Checks
controls.description: Perform an integrity check of software, firmware, and information at startup and at defined transitional states or security-relevant events.

controls.title: Spam Protection
controls.description: Employ spam protection mechanisms at system entry and exit points to detect and act on unsolicited messages.

controls.title: Information Input Validation
controls.description: Check the validity of information inputs.

controls.title: Error Handling
controls.description: Generate error messages that provide information necessary for corrective actions without revealing information exploitable by adversaries.

controls.title: Information Management and Retention
controls.description: Manage and retain information within the system and information output from the system in accordance with applicable laws, orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, guidelines, and operational requirements.

controls.title: Memory Protection
controls.description: Implement security controls to protect system memory from unauthorized code execution.

domains.name: Supply Chain Risk Management
domains.description: Supply chain risk management, component authenticity, and provenance

controls.title: Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate supply chain risk management policy.

controls.title: Supply Chain Risk Management Plan
controls.description: Develop a plan for managing supply chain risks associated with the development, acquisition, maintenance, and disposal of systems.

controls.title: Supply Chain Risk Management Plan — Establish SCRM Team
controls.description: Establish a supply chain risk management team to lead and support SCRM activities.

controls.title: Supply Chain Controls and Processes
controls.description: Establish a process to identify and address weaknesses or deficiencies in the supply chain elements and processes.

controls.title: Acquisition Strategies, Tools, and Methods
controls.description: Employ acquisition strategies, contract tools, and procurement methods that limit supply chain risk.

controls.title: Supplier Assessments and Reviews
controls.description: Assess and review the supply chain-related risks associated with suppliers or contractors.

controls.title: Notification Agreements
controls.description: Establish agreements and procedures with entities involved in the supply chain to receive notification of supply chain compromises.

controls.title: Component Authenticity
controls.description: Develop and implement anti-counterfeit policy and procedures that include the means to detect and prevent counterfeit components.
